ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_women] Grouping and Level-envy
ygData.msgSnippet: One good way to group is to try small groups.  Lots of people seem to think that you should try and get groups of 5 or 6, but groups of 2 or 3 can work really
ygData.messageBody:
One good way to group is to try small groups. Lots of people seem to
think that you should try and get groups of 5 or 6, but groups of 2 or 3
can work really well.

As a druid, you are an ideal partner for a tank. Pure tanks like warriors
and rogues are usually happy to group with a healer.

I use to dislike twinking, but over time I have come to understand it. I
have twinked myself. For me twinking is simply to avoid aspects of the
game that I no longer find as entertaining. Usually with twinks, as with
any other players, it's fairly quick to figure out if they're decent
people or not. If someone is nice, whether they are twinked or not,
they're nice.

Tina

On Sat, 1 Jul 2000, Sandy Wright wrote:

> Ranalla,
> I envy you being a 14 lv druid, when I tell people I am ONLY lv 6,
> nobody wants to group with me! :(
> As far as grouping, I have only been in 3 different groups for any
> length of time (1-6 hours)
> The first group didn't know what they were doing. Of course, neither
> did I but they abandoned me in Lesser Feydark AND didn't split the loot
> fairly.
> The second group I was with was great! They were mostly lowbies (more
> experienced players with fairly low level characters). Lots of fun, and
> they really helped me out with strategies and not getting lost (dumb
> blonde syndrome!) I don't believe in twinking (sp?) but it is nice to
> get advice from more experienced folks.
> The third group didn't go so well. Each person had their own agenda,
> and couldn't agree on where to go and what to hunt. I didn't stay with
> them long.
>
> My advice for grouping-make sure everyone agrees on plan of action
> before you start-including where to go, what to hunt, any quests people
> are on, and order of looting.
>
>
